I guess we should modify localizer tests to not check supporting symbolic link in compressed files.
It simply fails on Windows, and I guess there's no workaround to make it work. I already tried testing with elevated command prompt.

kabhwan:

I found other reason which makes BlobStore UTs failing, delete existing file can be failed on Windows for various reason.
Main reason is a locked file, various processes try to open the file (Anti-virus and Windows search, too) and it can't be deleted unless closed.
(*Nix just allows to delete that file but actually keep that file unless no process open that file. So *Nix doesn't fail to delete file for the same reason.)

So we should consider how to handle when deletion of file / directory fails.

kabhwan:

I found related doc from Hadoop.
https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/BUILDING.txt#L358

Doc says...

"Several tests require that the user must have the Create Symbolic Links
privilege."

Supervisor cannot be run with user which doesn't have privilege of "creating symbolic link", so I wonder we're OK to leave a few sentences to cover. If there's a official guide from MS, linking that page would be good.

{ + slots = slotGroups.get(node); +}

else

{ + slots = new ArrayList(); + slotGroups.put(node, slots); +}

+slots.add(slot);
+ }
+
+ // sort by port: from small to large
+ for (List slots : slotGroups.values()) {
+Collections.sort(slots, new Comparator() {
+ @Override
+ public int compare(WorkerSlot o1, WorkerSlot o2)

{ +return o1.getPort() - o2.getPort(); + }

+});
+ }
+
+ // sort by available slots size: from large to small
+ List> list = new ArrayList>(slotGroups.values());
+ Collections.sort(list, new Comparator>() {
+@Override
+public int compare(List o1, List o2)

{ + return o2.size() - o1.size(); +}

+ });
+
+ return Utils.interleaveAll(list);
+}
+
+return null;
+ }

{ + executorToSlot = existingAssignment.getExecutorToSlot(); +}

+
+return Utils.reverseMap(executorToSlot);
+ }

+Set allExecutors = (Set) topology.getExecutors();

johnbaba:

not only leaving a few sentences to cover, but we can tell users how to get the privilege. Like this:
1) Launch secpol.msc via Start or Start → Run.

2) Open Security Settings → Local Policies → User Rights Assignment.

3) In the list, find the "Create symbolic links" item, which represents SeCreateSymbolicLinkPrivilege.

4) Double-click on the item and add yourself (or the whole Users group) to the list.
LGTM
